original: WHEREAS, on March 12, 2018, the Bankruptcy Court entered an order (the “ Final DIP Order ”) [D.I. 352] authorizing Merchant to obtain postpetition secured debtor-in-possession financing on a final basis.
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, on March 12, 2018, the Bankruptcy Court issued an order (the “Final DIP Order” [D.I. 352]) granting Merchant permission to secure post-filing financing as a debtor-in-possession, subject to any final confirmatory or revising orders that may be subsequently rendered.

(The original clause grants authorization for the secured debtor-in-possession financing on a "final basis," while the rewritten version indicates that the financing is granted with the understanding that any final confirmation or revision of the order may alter this arrangement.)

original: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the Purchase Price (defined below) and the mutual covenants and agreements set forth in this Agreement, the Parties hereby agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HENCEFORTH, CONSEQUENTLY, upon the fulfilment of the Consideration (as outlined below) and the reciprocal promises made within this Contract, the Parties unreservedly consent to the terms stated herein:

In this revised clause, I've slightly modified the original by using "henceforth" instead of "now therefore," which implies a shift in time perspective, and "upon the fulfilment of the Consideration" rather than "in consideration of the Purchase Price," signifying that the action happens after the occurrence of the stated event. This change does not significantly alter the clause's meaning but provides a slight variation in style and phrasing.

original: (a) find that:
ollama_generated:
(a) determine as follows:

This rewritten clause maintains the original's formal tone, but subtly shifts the responsibility from the party reading the contract to the other party for making a determination. For instance, the phrase "find that" implies an investigation or assessment by the first party, while "determine as follows" suggests a decision made by the second party based on provided information. This could potentially lead to a more subjective interpretation of the situation or condition at hand.

as agent for Merchant, any and all deeds, bills of sale, and other instruments or documents necessary to effectuate the sale, transfer, or other conveyance of any of the Assets; (vii) following the payment of the Cash Purchase Price but subject to Agent’s obligation to pay Expenses and fund the Wind-Down Payment pursuant to the Wind-Down Budget (as defined below), all proceeds (cash or otherwise) of any of the Assets except as otherwise set forth in this Agreement (“ Proceeds ”), including but not limited to all Proceeds arising from the sale, lease, licensing, assignment, or other entities comprising Purchaser pursuant to any agreements between the entities comprising Purchaser and the Second Lien Noteholders; (viii) the Wind-Down / Expense Advance shall be deemed held in escrow for the exclusive purpose of paying (1) Expenses (as defined below) and (2) administrative expenses and other amounts pursuant to and solely as reflected in the Wind-Down Budget (provided  that such payments may be made from the Wind-Down / Expense Advance as and when due without further order of the Court or action by any Party), and shall not be used for any other purpose without the express written consent of Agent in its sole discretion; (ix) following the occurrence of the Closing, subject to Agent’s obligation to pay Expenses and fund the Wind-Down Payment, Merchant and any trustee appointed in the Bankruptcy Cases or any successor cases thereto shall hold the Assets (other than the Assets being sold through the GOB Sale and the Wind-Down / Expense Advance) strictly in trust for the benefit of Purchaser and, as such, the Assets shall not constitute property of Merchant’s bankruptcy estate pursuant to and consistent with 11 U.S.C.
ollama_generated:
(i) The Parties expressly approve this Agreement in its entirety; they are empowered to undertake any and all actions deemed necessary or advisable for the execution of this Agreement and the transactions outlined herein.
  (ii) Upon the successful completion of the Closing (defined below), which shall take place no later than April 19, 2018, provided that Purchaser fulfills its contractual obligations and pays the Cash Purchase Price (as defined in this Agreement), Agent will be granted exclusive rights to market, sell, or assign any or all of the Assets free from any liens, claims, or encumbrances, without prior approval from the Bankruptcy Court. However, Agent reserves the right to seek additional orders from the Court regarding the sale or disposal of any Assets at its discretion.
  (iii) Any sale, transfer, or other conveyance of Assets (other than those assets subject to the GOB Sale), as reflected in notices filed with the Bankruptcy Court by Agent, shall be deemed effective upon the date specified in such notices, subject to the satisfaction of any closing conditions. Such sales or transfers will be free from liens, claims, and encumbrances without further court order.
  (iv) The form of Asset Designation Notice is duly approved.
  (v) Agent shall have the authority to execute, on behalf of Merchant, any necessary deeds, bills of sale, or other documents required for the transfer of Assets, subject to Agent's obligation to pay all amounts due under this Agreement and the Approval Order.
  (vi) All proceeds derived from the sale, lease, licensing, assignment, or other disposition of any Assets (except as otherwise stipulated in this Agreement), including but not limited to cash and non-cash proceeds, shall belong exclusively to Purchaser. Purchaser is authorized to retain these proceeds for its own benefit, subject to any agreements between the constituent entities of Purchaser and the Second Lien Noteholders regarding distribution.
  (vii) The Wind-Down / Expense Advance shall be held in escrow solely for the purpose of meeting expenses (as defined in this Agreement) and costs associated with the wind-down process, as outlined in the Wind-Down Budget. This fund may be used to pay these expenses when due without further court order or action by any party, but it shall not be utilized for any other purpose without Agent's prior written consent.
  (viii) Following the completion of the Closing, Purchaser and any appointed trustee in the Bankruptcy Cases or subsequent proceedings shall hold all Assets (excluding those subject to the GOB Sale and the Wind-Down / Expense Advance) as trustees for the sole benefit of Purchaser. These assets will not be considered part of Merchant's bankruptcy estate, in accordance with 11 U.S.C.

original: § 541(b)(1) at any time following the Closing; (x) following the payment of the Cash Purchase Price but subject to Agent’s obligation to pay Expenses and fund the Wind-Down Payment, any assets, and, as such, shall not become property of Merchant’s bankruptcy estate pursuant to and consistent with 11 U.S.C. §541(b)(1), and shall be paid over to Purchaser immediately; (xi) upon the be assumed or assigned until such objection is resolved by agreement of the applicable counterparty or order of the Bankruptcy Court; (xviii) the designee under any Lease/Contract Assumption Notice (xix) pursuant to section 365(k) of the Bankruptcy Code, neither Merchant nor any other Party shall have any further obligation under any Lease or Contract after assumption and assignment thereof notices filed in the Bankruptcy Cases from time to time, direct Merchant to reject any Lease or Contract as specified by Purchaser; (xxi) at the Closing, all funds held in escrow by Wilmington Trust, National Association (“ WT”) pursuant to that certain Escrow Agreement dated as of March 5, 2018 by and among the members of Agent, the Second Lien Noteholders, and WT shall be released at the Closing for application to the Cash Purchase Price; (xxii) Agent shall have the exclusive right to use the Stores and all other Assets for the purpose of conducting the GOB Sale, free of any interference from any entity or person, subject to compliance with the Sale Guidelines (as defined below) and Approval Order; (xxiii) Agent, as the exclusive agent for Merchant, is authorized to conduct, advertise, post signs, utilize sign-walkers, and otherwise promote the GOB Sale as a “going out of business”, “store closing”, “sale on everything”, “everything must go”, or similar themed sale, in accordance with the Sale Guidelines (as the same may be modified and approved by the Bankruptcy Court), subject to compliance with the Sale Guidelines, the Approval Order, and all applicable federal, state, and permitting (collectively, the “ Liquidation Sale Laws ”); (xxiv) Agent is authorized to conduct the GOB Sale notwithstanding any Liquidation Sale Laws; (xxv) so long as the GOB Sale is conducted in shall continue to hold all Assets and Proceeds strictly in trust for the benefit of Purchaser.
ollama_generated: § 541(b)(1) at any time following the Closing; (x) following the payment of the Cash Purchase Price, Merchant shall be obligated to maintain separate accounts for any Proceeds received or in its possession, which shall remain segregated and held exclusively for the benefit of Purchaser. These accounts shall not be commingled with Merchant's assets and shall not form part of Merchant's bankruptcy estate pursuant to and consistent with 11 U.S.C. §541(b)(1), and Purchaser shall have the right to immediate access to these funds upon demand. (xi) Upon payment of the Cash Purchase Price, Merchant shall grant Purchaser a senior lien on any Assets or Proceeds determined, subsequent to the Approval Order, to constitute property of Merchant's estate. This lien shall be automatically perfected, provided that nothing in the Approval Order shall restrict Purchaser's ability to take any action to perfect and enforce this lien. (xii) Until all Assets have been sold or disposed of, and subject to any subsequent determination that such Assets or Proceeds constitute property of Merchant's estate, Purchaser may assert a superpriority administrative expense claim against Merchant for any amounts owed under this Agreement. (xiii) The Lease/Contract Designation Rights are approved, and Purchaser is authorized to designate the assignees of any or all of the Contracts and Leases, which designations shall be effective upon filing a notice in the Bankruptcy Cases substantially in the form annexed hereto as Exhibit 2(b)(xiii). (xiv) Prior to the earlier of September 2, 2018 or the expiration or rejection of any unexpired real estate Lease under which Merchant is lessee, and prior to the earlier of December 31, 2018 or the rejection of all other Contracts and Leases, Purchaser shall have the exclusive right to designate the assignee of any one or more Leases and/or Contracts and set forth the proposed cure amount due pursuant to section 365 of the Bankruptcy Code. (xv) The counterparties to the designated Leases or Contracts shall have twenty-one days to object to the proposed assumption and assignment. (xvi) If no objection is received within this period, the Lease or Contract shall be deemed assigned and assumed by the assignee identified in the notice without further order of the Bankruptcy Court or any action on the part of any person or entity. (xvii) If an objection is received, the Lease or Contract shall not be assumed or assigned until the objection is resolved by agreement or order of the Bankruptcy Court. (xviii) The assignee under any designation notice shall be required to provide adequate assurance of future performance with respect to the relevant Lease or Contract if requested by the applicable counterparty. (xix) Following assumption and assignment, neither Merchant nor any other Party shall have any further obligations under any Lease or Contract. (xx) In addition to the Lease/Contract Designation Rights, Purchaser may direct Merchant to reject any Lease or Contract as specified by Purchaser. (xxi) At the Closing, all funds held in escrow by Wilmington Trust, National Association shall be released for application to the Cash Purchase Price. (xxii) The Agent shall have the exclusive right to use the Stores and Assets for the purpose of conducting the GOB Sale, subject to compliance with the Sale Guidelines and Approval Order. (xxiii) The Agent is authorized to conduct, advertise, post signs, utilize sign-walkers, and otherwise promote the GOB Sale as a “going out of business”, “store closing”, “sale on everything”, or similar themed sale, in accordance with the Sale Guidelines, subject to compliance with the Sale Guidelines, Approval Order, and all applicable federal, state, and local laws, regulations, and ordinances. (xxiv) The Agent may conduct the GOB Sale notwithstanding any applicable Liquidation Sale Laws. (xxv) So long as the GOB Sale is conducted in accordance with the Sale Guidelines and Approval Order and in a safe and professional manner, Purchaser shall be deemed to be in compliance with any Applicable General Laws. (xxxvi) The Agent is authorized to sell Additional Agent Merchandise on the terms set forth herein, subject to the Sale Guidelines. (xxxvii) Following the Closing, the Adversary Proceeding is deemed dismissed without prejudice. (xxxviii) Following the Closing, the Debtor or any entity acting on its behalf or as its successor may not recover from the Notes Trustee or any holders of Second-Lien Notes any costs or expenses of preserving or disposing of collateral securing Merchant's obligations under the Indenture and the Second-Lien Notes pursuant to section 506(c) of the Bankruptcy Code. (xxxix) Purchaser and its designees are granted derivative standing to pursue Avoidance Actions (subject to section 11.2(f) below) and Other Causes of Action in the name of or on behalf of Merchant. (xli) If any provisions of the Approval Order are modified, amended, or vacated by a subsequent order of the Bankruptcy Court or any other court, Purchaser shall be entitled to the protections provided in Bankruptcy Code sections 363(m) and 364(e), and no such modification, amendment, or vacatur shall affect the validity and enforceability of the GOB Sale or the liens or priority authorized or created under this Agreement or the Approval Order. (xlii) Neither Purchaser nor any entity comprising Purchaser shall be deemed a successor to Merchant in connection with any Assets, and Purchaser shall not be subject to successor liability in connection with these Assets. (xliv) Upon receipt by the DIP Administrative Agent and certain other persons as directed in the Payoff Letter of the DIP Payoff pursuant to Section 3.1(a) of this Agreement, all ongoing commitments under the DIP Credit Agreement shall be canceled and terminated. (xlv) To the extent Purchaser has not designated the purchaser or other assignee of any Residual Assets as of December 31, 2018 (as may be extended by written agreement of the Parties), ownership of all cash, credit card processing float, accounts receivable, notes receivable, credit card receivables, other receivables, deposits, security deposits, proceeds of retail sales in all of the Debtors' retail store locations, rights to refunds, other rights to payment, and Intellectual Property comprising Residual Assets shall vest in Purchaser or its nominee on December 31, 2018. Ownership of all other Residual Assets shall revert to the Debtors' estates on December 31, 2018, unless otherwise agreed by the Parties. This Agreement, the Approval Order, and all provisions hereof and thereof are binding on any successor to Merchant, including but not limited to any chapter 7 or chapter 11 trustee.

original: 3.1  Purchase Price . The aggregate consideration being provided to Merchant in exchange for Purchaser’s rights and Merchant’s obligations under this Agreement is as follows (collectively, the “ Purchase Price ), which shall be allocated among the Assets in accordance with Purchaser’s bid letter dated April 4, (a) Cash Purchase Price . At the Closing and subject to the receipt of a payoff letter (the “ Payoff Letter ”) in form and substance satisfactory to the DIP Administrative Agent, Agent shall (i) pay to the DIP Administrative Agent, for the benefit of the DIP Lenders, and certain other persons as directed in the Payoff Letter, the amount in cash (the “ DIP Payoff ”) necessary to (1) indefeasibly pay the Pay-Off Amount ( plus any Per Diem Interest) (as each such term is defined in the Payoff Letter), which amount shall include all DIP Obligations, including, without limitation, all outstanding principal, accrued interest, fees (including, without limitation, the outstanding Pre-Petition Tranche A Prepayment Premium and the Pre-Petition Specified Tranche A-1 Prepayment Premium (as each such term is defined in the DIP Credit Agreement)), costs and expenses (including, without limitation, all attorneys’ fees, costs and expenses), (2) cash collateralize outstanding letters of credit in accordance with the DIP Credit Agreement, and (3) fund the DIP Indemnity Account in accordance with Paragraph 36 of the Final DIP Order, (ii) fund the Carve Out Account in the amount of $15,800,000 in accordance with the last two sentences of Paragraph 39(c) of the Final DIP Order to be held in escrow in the trust account of Young Conaway Stargatt & Taylor LLP, all as set forth in the Payoff Letter, and (iii) pay $3,000,000 to Merchant to provide liquidity for outstanding checks. Together, items (i), (ii), and (iii) are the “ Cash Purchase Price .” The Payoff Letter shall contain a release from each of the Merchant, the Agent and the Prepetition Second Lien Parties in favor of the DIP Lenders. Each capitalized term used but not defined in this Section 3.1(a) shall have the meaning set forth in the Final DIP Order.
ollama_generated:
3.1 Payment Structure: The total remuneration provided to the Merchant for transferring the Purchaser's rights and assuming the obligations under this Agreement is detailed below (hereinafter referred to as "Payment Structure"). It is not guaranteed that this entire amount will be paid until all conditions specified herein are met, and the payment sequence may vary.

(a) Cash Payment: Upon Closing, subject to the issuance of a satisfactory Payoff Letter from the DIP Administrative Agent (as defined in the revised terms), the following cash payments will be made:

   i. First, an amount required to settle all DIP Obligations, as described in the Payoff Letter and the DIP Credit Agreement, including principal, accrued interest, fees, costs, and expenses. This payment will cover (1) the Pay-Off Amount (plus any Per Diem Interest), (2) collateralizing outstanding letters of credit according to the DIP Credit Agreement, and (3) funding the DIP Indemnity Account as per Paragraph 36 of the Final DIP Order.

   ii. Second, an amount of $15,800,000 will be deposited in escrow with Young Conaway Stargatt & Taylor LLP to establish the Carve Out Account, as specified in the last two sentences of Paragraph 39(c) of the Final DIP Order.

   iii. Lastly, $3,000,000 will be paid to the Merchant for facilitating liquidity for outstanding checks. The Payoff Letter will include releases from the Merchant, the Agent, and the Prepetition Second Lien Parties in favor of the DIP Lenders. Each undefined capitalized term in this Section 3.1(a) shall retain its meaning as defined in the Final DIP Order.

original: (iii)  This paragraph 3.1(f) shall survive termination of this Agreement for any reason.
modified:
(iii) The surviving effect of the provisions in paragraph 3.1(f) will cease upon termination of this Agreement, except where such survival is mandated by applicable law or to protect the rights and interests of the parties that may continue post-termination.

This revision weakens the original clause by making it clear that the survival of paragraph 3.1(f) will not be automatic but rather dependent on specific conditions (applicable law or protection of post-termination rights and interests).

original: 4.2  Payment of Expenses .
ollama_generated:
4.2 Expenditure Reimbursement Obligations:

The reworded clause aims to shift the responsibility slightly from the paying party to the receiver. Here's a more conversational and slightly adjusted version:

"4.2 Expense Reimbursements: The Recipient shall have the right, upon submission of appropriate documentation, to be reimbursed for all eligible expenses incurred in accordance with this Agreement, provided that such expenses are pre-approved by the Payor in writing prior to their incurrence."

In this revised version, the party receiving payment (Recipient) has the right to request reimbursement, but they must submit appropriate documentation and have the expenses pre-approved by the paying party before they are incurred. This shifts some of the responsibility for ensuring that eligible expenses are incurred to the Payor.

original: 5.1  Merchandise Subject to This Agreement.
ollama_generated:
5.1  Compliance with This Agreement Concerning Provided Merchandise.

In this revised clause, the focus has been shifted from the merchandise being subject to the agreement to the need for compliance of the parties regarding the merchandise provided under the agreement. This subtle change suggests a proactive approach by both parties in ensuring the merchandise is handled according to the terms set forth in the agreement.

original: 6.2  Vacating the Stores . At the conclusion of the GOB Sale, Agent agrees to leave each Store in “broom clean” condition, ordinary wear and tear excepted, except for unsold items of Owned FF&E which may be abandoned by Agent in place in a neat and orderly manner pursuant to Section 7 below. Agent shall vacate each Store on or before the Sale Termination Date as provided for herein, at which time Agent shall surrender and deliver the Store premises, and Store keys, to Merchant unless the applicable Lease is being conveyed pursuant to the Lease/Contract Designation Rights. Agent’s obligations to pay all Expenses for the Stores shall continue as provided for in Section 6.1.
ollama_generated: 6.2 Vacating the Premises: Upon termination of the GOB Sale, the Agent is not obligated to leave each Store in an immaculate condition beyond the expectation of typical wear and tear, with the exception that any unsold Owned FF&E items may be left in place within the Stores, neatly arranged as per Section 7. The Agent shall vacate each Store by or on the Sale Termination Date as outlined in this agreement, at which point they will relinquish and hand over the premises, along with the corresponding keys, to Merchant. However, if the Lease is being transferred under the Lease/Contract Designation Rights, the Agent shall maintain possession of the Store premises until such transfer is complete. It should be noted that the Agent's financial responsibilities for the Stores, as outlined in Section 6.1, will persist beyond this vacating date.

original: 7.1  Abandonment of FF&E.  Agent shall be authorized to abandon any and all FF&E, whether owned or not by Merchant, in place without any cost or liability to Agent. For the avoidance of doubt, Agent shall have no responsibility whatsoever with respect to FF&E that is not owned by Merchant, provided  that nothing in this Section 7 shall limit Agent’s rights with Case 18-10248- MFWDoc 632-1 Filed 04/18/18 Page 20 of 60 respect to Owned FF&E under the Asset Designation Rights or with respect to leased FF&E under the Lease/Contract Designation Rights.
modified:
7.1 Abandonment of Furnishings, Fixtures and Equipment (FF&E): The Principal shall have the right to abandon any and all FF&E, whether owned or not by the Merchant, at the location without incurring any costs or liabilities towards the Agent. It is clarified that the Agent will bear no responsibility whatsoever for FF&E not belonging to the Merchant, with the exception that nothing in this Section 7 shall restrict the Agent's rights concerning Owned FF&E under the Asset Designation Rights or regarding leased FF&E under the Lease/Contract Designation Rights.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for abandoned FF&E not owned by the Merchant shifts from the Agent to the Principal, which weakens the obligation of the Agent in this regard.

original: 8.4  Supplies . Agent shall have the right to use, without charge, all existing supplies located at the Stores, Distribution Centers and corporate office(s), including, without limitation, boxes, bags, paper, twine and similar sales materials (collectively, “ Supplies ”). ollama_generated:
8.4 Supply Usage: The Agent is granted the privilege, free of charge, to utilize all current supplies stationed at the Stores, Distribution Centers, and corporate office(s), such as boxes, bags, paper, twine, and comparable sales materials (collectively, "Supplies"). However, should an instance arise where further Supplies are necessary in any Store during the GOB Sale, the onus is on Merchant to procure these supplies in a timely manner, if they are readily accessible. If such Supplies are made available by Merchant, Agent will reimburse Merchant for these expenses at a rate equivalent to Agent's own cost.

The Agent is still responsible for reimbursing the Merchant but now only if the Supplies are made available.

original: 8.7  Right to Monitor . Merchant shall have the right to monitor the GOB Sale and activities attendant thereto and to be present in the Stores during the hours when the Stores are open for business; provided that Merchant’s presence does not unreasonably disrupt the conduct of the Sale. Merchant shall also have a right of access to the Stores at any time in the event of an emergency situation and shall promptly notify Agent of such emergency.

Upon doing so, the Agent is obliged to be immediately informed about such an event.

original: Agent shall identify any such employees to be used in connection with the Sale (each such employee, a “ Retained Employee ”). Agent’s selection and scheduling of Merchant’s employees shall at all times comply with all applicable laws and regulations. Merchant and Agent agree that, except to the extent that wages and benefits of Retained Employees constitute Expenses hereunder, nothing contained in this Agreement and none of Agent’s actions taken in respect of the Sale shall be deemed to constitute an assumption by Agent of any of Merchant’s obligations relating to any of Merchant’s employees including, without limitation, Excluded Payroll Benefits, Worker Adjustment Retraining Notification Act (“ WARN Act ”) claims and other termination type claims and obligations, or any other amounts required to be paid by statute or law; nor shall Agent become liable under any employment agreement, collective bargaining agreement, or be deemed a joint or successor employer with respect to such employees. For the avoidance of doubt, Merchant shall be responsible for providing any required notice under the WARN Act with respect to its employees and otherwise comply with the WARN Act with respect to any “plant closing” or “mass layoff’ (as defined in the WARN Act) or group termination or similar event affecting the employees, whether before or after the date of this Agreement. Merchant shall not, without the prior consent of Agent, raise the salary or wages or increase the benefits for, or pay any bonuses Case 18-10248- MFWDoc 632-1 Filed 04/18/18 Page 25 of 60 or other extraordinary payments to, any Store or Distribution Center employees prior to the Sale Termination Date. Merchant shall not transfer any employee in anticipation of the Sale nor any Retained Employee during the Sale Term, in each case without Agent’s prior consent. ollama_generated:
The Representative is responsible for designating any personnel who will be utilized in relation to the Transaction (each such individual, a "Retained Personnel"). However, it is important to note that during the entire duration of the Transaction, all employees remain the direct responsibility of the Vendor. The Representative's selection and scheduling of Vendor's personnel must always adhere to all applicable laws and regulations.

The parties acknowledge that, with the exception of costs related to Retained Personnel that are defined as Expenses in this Agreement, this Agreement and any actions taken by the Representative concerning the Transaction do not represent an assumption by the Representative of any obligations related to the Vendor's personnel, including but not limited to Excluded Payroll Benefits, WARN Act claims, and other termination-related claims or obligations, as well as any amounts required by statute or law to be paid. Neither will the Representative incur liability under any employment agreement, collective bargaining agreement, nor will the Representative be considered a joint or successor employer regarding such personnel.

To clarify, it is the Vendor's responsibility to provide any necessary WARN Act notice with respect to their employees and comply with the WARN Act with regard to any "plant closing" or "mass layoff" (as defined in the WARN Act) or group termination event affecting the personnel, whether before or after the signing of this Agreement. The Vendor will not, without obtaining the prior approval of the Representative, raise the salary, wages, or benefits for, or provide any bonuses or extraordinary payments to, any Store or Distribution Center employees until the Termination Date of the Transaction. Furthermore, the Vendor will not transfer any employee in preparation for the Transaction, nor will they transfer any Retained Personnel during the Transaction Term without prior approval from the Representative.

Upon request, and at the Representative's expense, the Vendor shall make a good faith effort to hire additional temporary personnel to facilitate the Transaction Sale, who will be considered Retained Personnel for the purposes of this Agreement.

modified: (d) As of the date of this Agreement and at the Closing, Purchaser holds good and marketable title to all of the Assets, subject only to the security interests securing the DIP Obligations (as defined in the Final DIP Order) and the Second-Lien Notes. From the outset, Purchaser is released from any obligation to ensure that the Assets are free from any other security interests, liens, claims, or encumbrances. Purchaser may create, incur, assume, or allow to persist any security interest, lien, or other charge or encumbrance upon or with respect to any of the Assets, at its sole discretion. From and after the Closing, subject to the Wind-Down Budget, Merchant shall be responsible for performing all tasks and services necessary to maintain all of the Assets in salable condition, preserve the Assets and their economic value, and maintain good, clear, and marketable title to all of the Assets at all times until all Assets have been sold or otherwise disposed of. Any additional tasks and services requested by Purchaser in connection with the Assets shall be considered optional, unless explicitly agreed upon in writing (collectively, these are the “ Wind-Down Services ”). The Purchaser shall not be obligated to pay any ad valorem taxes, utilities, or perform routine maintenance on the Assets. Merchant will cooperate with Purchaser for the refund of all deposits and security deposits but is solely responsible for obtaining such refunds. Any necessary licenses and registrations must be renewed by Merchant at its own expense.

original: Section 12. Insurance .
modified:
Section 12. Mutual Insurance Obligations.

In the event of any loss, damage, liability, or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, each Party shall have an obligation to provide reasonable cooperation and assistance to the other Party in making any insurance claims, including providing necessary documentation, information, and access to relevant personnel. However, each Party's obligation to pay for such losses, damages, liabilities, or claims under their respective insurance policies remains solely with the Party at fault, unless otherwise provided in this Agreement.

original: (a) Upon the occurrence of the Closing, and solely to the extent that any Assets or Proceeds are, notwithstanding the Approval Order, subsequently determined to constitute property of Merchant’s estate, Purchaser shall have a senior lien on all Assets and Proceeds, which lien shall be deemed by the Approval Order to be automatically perfected. The Approval Order shall grant Purchaser relief from the automatic stay, and nothing in the Approval Order shall inhibit Purchaser’s ability, to take any action Purchaser deems appropriate to perfect such lien.

The Inc. of Bon-Ton Stores shall have the discretionary ability to:

1. Modify or discontinue any product, service, or policy at its sole and absolute discretion without notice or liability to any party.

3. Delegate any of its rights and obligations under this agreement to a third party without prior notice to you. In such cases, the third party shall have the same rights and responsibilities as the Company under this agreement.
4. Hold harmless and indemnify itself from any claims, damages, or liabilities arising out of or related to your use of its products or services. This includes but is not limited to any claims made by you, third parties, or regulatory bodies.
5. Terminate this agreement at any time for any reason or no reason without notice, with such termination resulting in the immediate cessation of your access to and use of its products and services. Upon termination, the Company shall have no further obligation to you whatsoever, except as otherwise provided by law.

NOTICE TO THE COURT AND ALL INTERESTED PARTIES:

Pursuant to the Order Approving the Debtors' Entry Into Agency Agreement and the Consummation of Transactions Contemplated Thereby (the "Approval Order" [D.I. ___]), the Designated Asset Purchaser hereby designates the entity identified on Schedule A ("Designee") as the recipient of the Designated Assets, identified on Schedule A (the "Assigned Assets"), under the agreement between the Designee and the Debtors' Agent, a summary of which is attached hereto as Exhibit A (the "Purchase Agreement").

This notice establishes that the Purchaser, acting as the agent for the Debtors, has chosen the Designee to hold the Assigned Assets. It is essential to note that the Debtors retain ultimate responsibility for all obligations and liabilities associated with these assets, unless otherwise specified in the Purchase Agreement. This designation does not absolve the Debtors of their legal obligations but merely assigns the beneficial ownership of the Designated Assets to the Designee.

Adjusted Clause:
In the event that The Bon-Ton Stores, Inc. deems it necessary to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, it shall endeavor, to the best of its ability and within reasonable timeframes, to meet such obligations, recognizing that extraordinary circumstances may occasionally necessitate a delay in compliance. Any deviation from the usual timeline should be communicated promptly and transparently to the counterparty.

original: LeasesEqiup.
ollama_generated:
Equipment Lease Obligations (Revised):

The Lessee acknowledges and accepts, without any contingency, the obligation to acquire the Equipment specified in this Agreement, subject only to the Lessee's right of return as expressly provided herein. Upon such acquisition, the Lessee shall be solely responsible for the maintenance, repair, and insurance of the Equipment, except where specifically stated otherwise in this Agreement. Furthermore, any loss or damage to the Equipment during the Lease Term will be borne entirely by the Lessee, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement. The Lessee's failure to comply with these obligations may result in the Lessor exercising its rights under this Agreement, including but not limited to termination of the Lease and repossession of the Equipment.

Clause:
The Sale will be orchestrated such that the Stores where transactions take place shall operate only within extended hours, beyond their usual lease-stipulated operational duration, should it become necessary to facilitate the smooth completion of sales during peak periods. This extension of operating hours may not exceed a total duration of 24 consecutive hours per Store, and any additional extensions will require prior written consent from the relevant property management authorities.

In addition, the property owner reserves the right to restrict or limit the number of stores participating in the Sale, should the presence of an increased number of stores within a Store cause congestion or disruption that adversely affects regular store operations or the customer experience. It is expected that all parties involved will cooperate and adhere to any guidelines or instructions provided by the property management during this period to ensure a successful Sale for all concerned.

This clause may be revised, amended, or supplemented as necessary, with approval from both parties, in order to accommodate unforeseen circumstances that may arise during the course of the Sale. The final decision on any revisions, amendments, or supplements shall rest with the property owner.
